result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven W Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven W Shaw is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven W Shaw was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Steven W Shaw was found guilty of Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.
  • Steven W Shaw was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Steven W Shaw was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to the State of Colorado.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution hearing held on 2/17/2016: Restitution was ordered of $317.72.  Apply bail
to this and all court costs, DNA. Refund remaining bail to posters.

CORRECTION ON 2/19/2016: Restitution was $731.72, not $317.72, the difference was added of $414.00

Court Costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any of the victims/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 30 DAYS - NON WORKING HOURS (HUBER) release for employment/treatment.
LAST 60 DAYS - STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without non working hours (Huber).
Sentence to commence 12-28-2015 by 06:00 p.m. 
Apply 2 days sentence credit.

Defendant Steven W Shaw in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing: State presents arguments. Defense counsel presents arguments. Court imposed the following sentence: 
   The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

Ct. 1- 30  days jail
Ct. 4 - 5 months jail
Ct. 5 - 30 days jail
Ct. 6 - 6 months, to all run consecutive to each other

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  AS TO EACH COUNT
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  any victims/witnesses listed in the criminal complaint
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

RESTITUTION:  To be determined and bail to remain in trust until the restitution hearing. Bail on 15CF478 can be refunded back to the poster.

FINE or COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 90 days, 1st 30 days with huber for employment/treatment the last 60 days STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours. Sentence to commenc 12/28/2015 by 6 pm (2 days credit)

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Early termination of probation is denied.
Probation can be tranferred to the State of CO
